fact_list.fact_text: Expressway Monitoring and Advisory Systems (EMAS) include three types of electronic signboards used on expressways and selected major arterial roads.
Travel Time Display (TTD) electronic advisory signboards are placed at various entrances leading to expressways.
TTDs provide estimated travel times to selected exits on the expressways from the point the motorist enters a particular expressway.
The estimated travel times displayed on TTDs are shown in color.
Green color on TTDs indicates the travel time displayed is up to 50% more than normal travel time.
Yellow color on TTDs indicates the travel time displayed is between 50% to 125% more than normal travel time.
Red color on TTDs indicates the travel time displayed is more than 125% of normal travel time.
Messages about incidents on the expressway are displayed on TTD signboards.
An example message "ACCIDENT on CTE (SLE)" displayed on TTD informs motorists of an accident occurring on CTE towards SLE.
The phrase "ACCIDENT" toggles with "ON CTE (AYE)" on TTDs to inform motorists of an accident occurrence on CTE towards AYE.
TTDs like these will be phased out.
